snippet: Some officials blame the government’s actions for the shuttering of some of these start-ups created under the Affordable Care Act.

byline.original: By REED ABELSON and ABBY GOODNOUGH

abstract: Eight alternative health insurers formed under Affordable Care Act are shutting down, leaving only 14 so-called co-op insurers left; about 500,000 customers are looking for health coverage for 2016, leaving them with fewer choices and possibly higher rates.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

keywords.value: Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: Some officials blame the government’s actions for the shuttering of some of these start-ups created under the Affordable Care Act.

headline.print_headline: Health Care Co-op Closings Narrow Consumers’ Choices
headline.main: Health Care Co-op Closings Narrow Consumers’ Choices
